getURL

public static java.lang.String[] getURL(java.lang.String server,
                                        java.lang.String urlStr,
                                        int[] sockets)
perform a http GET to the specified server and url. result is a string array

Parameters:
server -
urlStr -
sockets - an array of socket numbers to try, or null to try the standard list util.URLs.web_server_sockets
Returns:
a String[] where element 0 is an error message, or element 1 is the text returned from the url

Parameters:
server -
urlStr -
data -
sockets - an array of socket numbers to try, or null to try the standard list util.URLs.web_server_sockets
result[] - the results array to be returned
Returns:
a String[] where element 0 is an error message, or element 1 is the text returned from the url

getURLStream

public static java.io.InputStream getURLStream(java.lang.String host,
                                               int socket,
                                               java.lang.String url)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
get the url contents using a socket number as spec. This is the preferred method because it uses standard applet HTTP 1.1 behavior instead of hand-rolled HTTP 1.0 requests used by the old method.

Parameters:
host -
socket - socket number to use (default should be 80)
url -
Returns:
a binary stream which presents the data from the url
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getURLReader

public static java.io.BufferedReader getURLReader(java.lang.String host,
                                                  int socket,
                                                  java.lang.String url)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
get the url contents using a socket number as spec. This is the preferred method because it uses standard applet HTTP 1.1 behavior instead of hand-rolled HTTP 1.0 requests used by the old method.

Parameters:
host -
socket - socket number to use (default should be 80)
url -
Returns:
a text stream which presents the data from the url
Throws:
java.io.IOException

escape

public static java.lang.String escape(java.lang.String d)
escape an arbitrary string for transmission as form data. This should be used on the data portion of a parameter, ie; "?foo="+escape(bar)

postURLStream

public static java.io.InputStream postURLStream(java.lang.String host,
                                                int socket,
                                                java.lang.String url,
                                                java.lang.String data,
                                                java.lang.String[] result)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
open a http connection to the speficied host, port, and url, using method POST if data is not null, or GET if it is null, with the specified data string as the body. It's ok to supply both ?xx with the url and data.

Parameters:
host -
socket -
url -
data -
result - is an array of 3 strings, or null. If supplied, postURLStream will set the third strings to the concatenated result headers.
Returns:
a binary reader stream for the data returned from the URL
Throws:
java.io.IOException

postURLReader

public static java.io.BufferedReader postURLReader(java.lang.String host,
                                                   int socket,
                                                   java.lang.String url,
                                                   java.lang.String data,
                                                   java.lang.String[] result)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
open a http connection to the specified host, port, and url, using method POST if data is not null, or GET if it is null, with the specified data string as the body. It's ok to supply both ?xx with the url and data.

Parameters:
host -
socket -
url -
data -
result - is an array of 3 strings, or null. If supplied, postURLStream will set the third strings to the concatenated result headers.
Returns:
a text reader stream for the data returned from the URL
Throws:
java.io.IOException

postAlert

public static boolean postAlert(java.lang.String caller,
                                java.lang.String message)
this post a message to the server and registers an alert email. This is used only for very alarming or unusual occurrences.

Parameters:
caller - an arbitrary string, the alert will be from: user
message -
Returns:
true if the alert was posted
